sections.title: Insurance Contracts
sections.description: Checklist for presentation and disclosure requirements under IFRS 4.

items.question: Has the entity disclosed its accounting policies for insurance contracts and related assets, liabilities, income and expense?
Has the entity disclosed the recognised assets, liabilities, income and expense arising from insurance contracts?
If the entity is a cedant, has it disclosed gains and losses recognised on buying reinsurance?
Has the entity disclosed the process used to determine the assumptions that have the greatest effect on the measurement of recognised amounts?
Has the entity disclosed information about the nature and extent of risks arising from insurance contracts?
Has the entity disclosed information about risk management objectives and policies for mitigating risks arising from insurance contracts?
Has the entity disclosed information about the terms and conditions of insurance contracts that have a material effect on the amount, timing and uncertainty of future cash flows?
Has the entity disclosed information to identify and explain the amounts in its financial statements arising from insurance contracts?

Has the entity disclosed its accounting policies for insurance contracts and related assets, liabilities, income and expense, including how it determines the carrying amount of financial assets and insurance liabilities?
Has the entity disclosed how the assumptions used in the measurement relate to observable market prices or rates?
